title: How to Make a Homemade Friendly's Friend‐Z

steps.headline: Choose a favorite ice cream candy topping.
steps.description: It can be unhealthy (Kit-Kat pieces, ground M&Ms, or ground Reese's Pieces, etc.) or healthy (bananas and strawberries). The possibilities of variations of things you can use as toppings are nearly endless.

steps.headline: Choose an ice cream flavor.
steps.description: Even though Friendly's only uses the two most popular flavors (vanilla and chocolate) for their Friend-Z's, you can make one with any ice cream on the market.

steps.headline: Chop the toppings into little pieces, but do not totally obliterate the pieces until they become granular/crystalline in structure.
steps.description: Place these toppings inside a medium to large-sized cup until used later.

steps.headline: Place 3-4 scoops of your ice-cream choice inside a food blender.
steps.description: Do not completely fill the blender bowl entirely, and be sure to cover before use.

steps.headline: Allow the blender to create a rich and creamy ice cream.
steps.description: If needed, add a little milk into the ice cream to soften. If the cream is closer to a soupy mixture, throw out the mixture (or freeze for later eating) and start the blending process over with other ice cream flavors. The mixture has to be just right to be close to the Friendly's way.

steps.headline: Open the top of the blender with the motor still running.
Dump the topping pieces into the blender while the blender is running.
Close the top of the blender again.
Allow the pieces to fully blend into the mixture.
Stop the blender when there are only a few pieces of the topping at the top and sides of the mixture, as they will have fully mixed in now.
Dump the ice cream out and into some cups and immediately serve at this temperature.

text: Choose a favorite ice cream candy topping. It can be unhealthy (Kit-Kat pieces, ground M&Ms, or ground Reese's Pieces, etc.) or healthy (bananas and strawberries). The possibilities of variations of things you can use as toppings are nearly endless. Choose an ice cream flavor. Even though Friendly's only uses the two most popular flavors (vanilla and chocolate) for their Friend-Z's, you can make one with any ice cream on the market. Chop the toppings into little pieces, but do not totally obliterate the pieces until they become granular/crystalline in structure. Place these toppings inside a medium to large-sized cup until used later. Place 3-4 scoops of your ice-cream choice inside a food blender. Do not completely fill the blender bowl entirely, and be sure to cover before use. Start the blender. The motor will turn on. Allow the blender to create a rich and creamy ice cream. If needed, add a little milk into the ice cream to soften. If the cream is closer to a soupy mixture, throw out the mixture (or freeze for later eating) and start the blending process over with other ice cream flavors. The mixture has to be just right to be close to the Friendly's way. Open the top of the blender with the motor still running.  Dump the topping pieces into the blender while the blender is running.  Close the top of the blender again.  Allow the pieces to fully blend into the mixture.  Stop the blender when there are only a few pieces of the topping at the top and sides of the mixture, as they will have fully mixed in now.  Dump the ice cream out and into some cups and immediately serve at this temperature.
